candidates.title: Update dependencies and remove GPL v3.0 from accepted licenses

labels.name: F9-dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Cargo update to use the newest dependencies of Substrate and potential security risk of `spin-rs`. Several clippy fixes were necessary, but no logic changes introduced.

fixes #531 
fixes #525

candidates.title: Clean up dependencies and fix primitives no_std build
candidates.body:
As preparatory steps for publishing on crates.io:

1. Clean up the toml files:
    - remove unused dependencies
    - import frame-metadata from crates.io instead of github (less changes necessary for publishing on crates.io)
    - complete the toml file description of each crate

2. Additionally, found while cleaning dependencies:
    - fix primitives crate no_std build and include the build test in CI

3. Removed `assert` in error example because it constantly failed (substrate upgrade?). But since there is no decoding anyway, I don't see the use case in checking the encoded error.

4. Last, but not least:
    - add READMEs to each crate

candidates.title: Update to Substrate commit `7363dce`
candidates.body:
Cargo update of substrate and fix compiler errors:
- run `cargo update -p sp-core` 
- re-copy paste client keystore to match new substrate version
- update pallet contracts config

Fix pallet transaction payment:
- add the new weight type of Substrate to `serde_impls` 
- update `RuntimeDispatchInfo` to use the new `Weight` type.

Fix license check:
- add GPL-v3.0 to accepted licenses as a temporary workaround for #525

fixes #519 
fixes #518

candidates.title: Make `pallet-staking` and `pallet-contracts` dependencies optional
candidates.body:
Include `pallet-staking` dependency only when staking-xt feature is enabled.
`pallet-contracts` is implemented along the same lines. `pallet-contracts` has a dependency on `wasmi` so it is nice if we can make this optional.

candidates.title: Udpate toml versions for tag v0.11.0

labels.name: E0-silent
labels.description: Will not be mentioned in the release

candidates.body:
Changes can be looked up here: https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/compare/v0.10.0...v0.11.0

Summary:
- `api-client`: ⚡  Contains breaking changes due to function renaming and pub re-exports removals.
- `client-keystore`:  ⚡  Breaking changes due to substrate update
- `compose-macros`:  ⚡  Breaking changes due to `pub use rpc::*` removal
- `examples`:  ⚡  follow the breaking changes of substrate
- `node-api`:  ⚡  breaking changes due to more restrictive public re-export
- `primitives`: ⚡  breaking changes due to more restrictive public re-export and file moving
- `testing`: ⚡  follow the breaking changes of substrate

candidates.title: Add StaticExtrinsicSigner struct
candidates.body:
Adds an additional ExtrinsicSigner that does not depend on Runtime input. Instead, the AccountId and Address are hardcoded, as this suffices for most substrate based chains.

closes #461

workaround for #504

candidates.title: Bump openssl from 0.10.45 to 0.10.48

labels.name: F9-dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [openssl](https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl) from 0.10.45 to 0.10.48.
Release notes

Sourced from openssl's releases.

openssl v0.10.48

What's Changed

  • Fix LibreSSL version checking in openssl/ by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#1851
  • Skip a test that hangs on OpenSSL 3.1.0 by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#1850
  • Improve reliability of some tests by @​smoelius in sfackler/rust-openssl#1852
  • Fix a series of security issues by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#1854
  • Release openssl v0.10.48 and openssl-sys v0.9.83 by @​alex in sfackler/rust-openssl#1855

New Contributors

  • @​smoelius made their first contribution in sfackler/rust-openssl#1852

Full Changelog: https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl/compare/openssl-v0.10.47...openssl-v0.10.48

openssl v0.10.47

No release notes provided.

openssl v0.10.46

No release notes provided.

Commits
  • 4ff734f Release openssl v0.10.48 and openssl-sys v0.9.83 (#1855)
  • 5efceaa Merge pull request #1854 from alex/davids-openssl-of-horrors
  • 6ced4f3 Fix race condition with X509Name creation
  • a752805 Document the horror show
  • 78aa9aa Always provide an X509V3Context in X509Extension::new because OpenSSL require...
  • 332311b Resolve an injection vulnerability in EKU creation
  • 482575b Resolve an injection vulnerability in SAN creation
  • 690eeb2 Merge pull request #1852 from smoelius/master
  • e5b6d97 Improve reliability of some tests
  • 319200a Merge pull request #1851 from alex/libressl-versions
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: update to newest substrate

labels.name: F9-dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
- Upgrade to substrate commit : https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/tree/8bd57418b79d2450079755c0d631168b8fad2e97
    - Change Keystore according to https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/commit/bf395c8308c481a9774373e0b0b14bd7a2e4b8d2 and https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/commit/9d2d020c5134d8c7870396cb04bca63a674abfd5
    - Change Balances because of https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12951. Note that
          - free, locked and reserved balances are defined differently  
          - Existential Deposit requirements to be made of the free balance, not the total balance
          - set_balance is new force_set_balance
          - transfer is transfer_allow_death
- Cargo update
- Fix the tests but the [DispatchError](https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/blob/33622f4d3e6a949e1a6efa507cff58173d74d856/node-api/src/error.rs#L79) should be improved to differentiate all DispatchError::Other. See issue https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/issues/488

candidates.title: Bump tokio from 1.23.1 to 1.24.2

labels.name: F9-dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.23.1 to 1.24.2.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.24.1

This release fixes a compilation failure on targets without AtomicU64 when using rustc older than 1.63. (#5356)

#5356: tokio-rs/tokio#5356

Tokio v1.24.0

The highlight of this release is the reduction of lock contention for all I/O operations (#5300). We have received reports of up to a 20% improvement in CPU utilization and increased throughput for real-world I/O heavy applications.

Fixed

  • rt: improve native AtomicU64 support detection (#5284)

Added

  • rt: add configuration option for max number of I/O events polled from the OS per tick (#5186)
  • rt: add an environment variable for configuring the default number of worker threads per runtime instance (#4250)

Changed

  • sync: reduce MPSC channel stack usage (#5294)
  • io: reduce lock contention in I/O operations (#5300)
  • fs: speed up read_dir() by chunking operations (#5309)
  • rt: use internal ThreadId implementation (#5329)
  • test: don't auto-advance time when a spawn_blocking task is running (#5115)

#5186: tokio-rs/tokio#5186 #5294: tokio-rs/tokio#5294 #5284: tokio-rs/tokio#5284 #4250: tokio-rs/tokio#4250 #5300: tokio-rs/tokio#5300 #5329: tokio-rs/tokio#5329 #5115: tokio-rs/tokio#5115 #5309: tokio-rs/tokio#5309

Commits

candidates.title: Remove thiserror
candidates.body:
- remove this error and replace with `derive_more` where possible. This should declutter some overly verbose error messages. Better for `no_std` environments.
- clean up some unused error values
- remove generic Result in ws client - not used anyway and makes it more complex than necessary
 
closes #317

candidates.title: Update .toml version
candidates.body:
I think it's time for the next tag `v0.9.0` :)

Lots happened, such as Trait introduction for the RpcClient and Api Client, almost full `no_std` support, introduction of jsonrpsee client and tungsenite client, new features, and so on.

Changes from now to tag v0.8.0 can be looked up here: https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/compare/v0.8.0...master#

Summary:
 - `ac-compose-macros` has new features (full no_std and rpc_params), no breaking changes.
 - `ac-examples` got newly created
 - `ac-node-api` implements new functions (such as `check_if_failed`), no breaking changes.
 - `ac-primitives`: removed of `hex_encode` function as well as enforcing Serializing in no_std. Therefore, breaking changes were introduced.
 - `api-client` : Lots of breaking changes.

candidates.title: Update to the newest substrate commit + cargo update
candidates.body:
Substrate update:
- Rename `SlashCancelOrigin` to `AdminOrigin`  (see https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/commit/c16472e7e4a588d8e202c1ab3e865cf6e7b201c5) 

Plus a general `cargo update`

candidates.title: Add TransactionStatus and Api unit tests
candidates.body:
- Add unit tests to `TransactionStatus` and `XtStatus`
- add unit test to complex functions of the `Api`
- introduce a mock implementing rpc `Request`

closes #316

candidates.title: Add `submit_and_watch_extrinsic_until_success` method
candidates.body:
Allows to watch an extrinsic and automatically checks if the extrinsic was successful or not (by retrieving and checking the associated events).

closes #288

candidates.title: Udpate to newest substrate master commit
Make api/rpc interfaces no_std compatible
candidates.body:
One step further towards `no_std` compatibility:
- `compsoe-macros` is now fully `no_std` compatible
- `api/rpc` is now fully `no_std` compatible
- remove unused `primitives-types` import in `Cargo.toml`

Drawbacks:
- `thiserror` needed to be changed to `thiserror-core`. But that should be temporary only. And better than removing it completely (I hope).
- Some errors needed to be changed from Error-Types to Strings, because they are not available in `no_std`.

one step towards  https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/issues/279

candidates.title: Make Api `no_std` compatible
candidates.body:
🌈  Featuring added `no_std` compatibility for the full `Api` included traits and the implementations (except for the rpc clients)
- removes `sp-std` dependency. Whenever possible, depend on `core` or `alloc` directly. The `std` version itself points to them as well. No need for an extra library to do that,
- Introduces a lot of substrate types in `primitives/serde_impls` to implement serde also in `no_std`. Wherever sensible, the conversion from substrate type and redefined type has been implemented with `From`. So the newly self-implemented types should not pose a big problem for the user.  Another good thing: If substrate updates the types, this will be noticed quite fast via the unit tests.
- Removed `MaybeSerializeDeserialize` because this only enforces (De)Serialization only in `std` mode.
- Reimplemented `NumberOrHex` because  `sp-rpc` is not `no_std` compatible. 
- Removed some unused error types in `src/api/error.rs`



closes #279

candidates.title: Clean up tomls
candidates.body:
- removes unused deps
- sorts deps according to no_std and std / wasm only
- update env_logger to v0.10.0

candidates.title: Move exampels to separate crate
candidates.body: This way, the examples don't need to inherit all the features of the api-client.  They import the api-client with the necessary features. This serves as a better example on how to import and use the api-client.

candidates.title: Add new test crate
candidates.body:
Test the full functionality of the api client.

Update CI build: 
- replace `--all` (deprecated) with `--workspace` (see https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/commands/cargo-build.html) 
- remove example build. Examples are built in `cargo test` anyway.
- Add some better namings to jobs / steps.

Not CI related:
- Remove example `get_existential_deposit`. That's not really an useful example and is covered by the tests now.

closes  #353

candidates.title: Add jsonrpsee as default rpc client

- Without jsonrpsee: 
```

2022-12-06 13:50:55 Accepting new connection 1/100

2022-12-06 13:50:55 Accepting new connection 1/100

2022-12-06 13:50:57 🎁 Prepared block for proposing at 110 (0 ms) [hash: 0xa57c1ca6755f5fb5e5a9d2bab7d6e4cbe44049400144a04c38850bd3b0d3cdd7; parent_hash: 0x5083…7ff3; extrinsics (2): [0x4d9f…c027, 0x6dda…1895]]
```

closes #133
closes #134 because jsonrpsee supports timeouts:  https://github.com/paritytech/jsonrpsee/blob/3a159638ed6c8ad4c80ad80bea74ef1d13f2f503/core/src/client/async_client/mod.rs#L98-L103

candidates.title: Bump secp256k1 from 0.24.0 to 0.24.2

labels.name: E0-silent
labels.description: Will not be mentioned in the release

labels.name: F9-dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [secp256k1](https://github.com/rust-bitcoin/rust-secp256k1) from 0.24.0 to 0.24.2.
Changelog

Sourced from secp256k1's changelog.

0.24.2 - 2022-12-05

  • Backport fix soundness issue with preallocated_gen_new

0.24.1 - 2022-10-25

  • Fix broken deserialization logic of KeyPair that previously always panicked. After the patch deserialization only panics if neither the global-context nor the alloc (default) feature is active.

  • 5c6225e Bump version to 0.24.2

  • 5e1e012 Merge rust-bitcoin/rust-secp256k1256: secp-sys: change symbol names to `0_6_...
  • 91f1096 secp-sys: change symbol names to 0_6_1 from 0_5_0
  • b00b194 Merge rust-bitcoin/rust-secp256k1256: move some unsafe code inside an unsafe...
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/network/alerts).

candidates.title: Add api traits
candidates.body:
Adds traits to the api and removes obsolete impl enforcements on the Api where possible (see #357)

closes #267

candidates.title: Bump crate versions
candidates.body:
Preparation for tag v0.8.0

Check diff from now to tag v0.7.0: https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/compare/v0.7.0...master

candidates.title: Support `tungstenite-rs` rpc client
candidates.body:
This PR

-  implement new rpc client with [tungstenite-rs ](https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs)
-  `tungstenite-client` attempt to reconnect to rpc node once disconnected

Run example with tungstenite
```bash
cargo run --no-default-features --features tungstenite-client,std --example get_storage
```

candidates.title: Enhance rpc interface and simplify ws client
candidates.body:
Preparatory step for jsonrpsee inclusion.  

💥  Breaking Changes:
- `send_extrinsic(...)` is exchanged with:
    - `submit_extrinsic`: Replaces the `TxStatus::SubmitOnly`. It directly returns and does not require any subscription. The transaction hash is returned.
    - `watch_extrinsic` and `watch_extrinsic_until`: Requires a subscription, if available, the block hash is returned.
- Subscription functions (`watch_extrinsic`, `subscribe_events` , ..) now handle the channel creation themselves. Instead of giving the `Sender` as an input, the `Receiver` is returned in a `WsSubscriptionWrapper`. The subscription value retrieved via the `next()` function (previously with `value.recv()`). This allows more freedom for the RpcClient implementation, as no mspc channel is enforced.

💚   Feature Changes:
- `RuntimeBlock` is now taken from the Runtime itself instead of a generic function return type.
- RpcClients now implement the function `with_default_url()` and allows external `unsubscription` by the client (via the `WsSubscriptionWrapper`).
- The RpcClients now handles the deserialization, not the api_client.
- Introduces `RpcParams` and the accompanying `rpc_params![..]` macro. This allows to introduce params handling according to the websockets expectation. 
- `json_req.rs` has been removed, as it's not necessary anymore: methods should only get called once per api function and the params are given separately. 
- `subscribe` (previously `start_subscriber`) now expects an additional `unsub` method. This is not yet used, but it allows for better sub / unsub handling in case a more elaborate ws-client is implemented (like jsonrpsee)
- `XtStatus` is now only used as input value. Return value is the substrate equivalent `TransactionStatus`, which can be deserialized directly from the rpc response.
- Heavily cleaned up unnecessary function of the `WsRpcClient` and `TungsteniteClient`

And some other minor corrections..

closes #175

candidates.title: Update frame-metdata and remove ed25519-zebra patch
candidates.body:
frame-metadata is now sourced from parity github instead of crates.io (which is very outdated)

closes #286 
closes #304

candidates.title: Clean up examples
candidates.body:
Rebased work of #242. Thanks goes to @ivanceras .

> - remove the `example_` prefix of all the examples
> - hard code the url endpoint and remove the `cli.yml` and the code for getting the url in each of the examples to make it more lean
> - remove deprecated code
> - Remove the executable permission of some files that don't need to be executable: `Cargo.toml`, `README.md`, license. 
>

candidates.title: Make api and primitives generic over Runtime
candidates.body:
- Types defined by the Runtime (Hash, Index, Balance .. ) are now not hardcoded any more, but depend on the Runtime input.
- Renamed generic parameter `P` (probably for Pair) to `Signer`
- Removed pallet dependencies completely from `no_std` due to default wasm compilation.

candidates.title: Remove substrate versioning and cargo update
candidates.body:
- Removes substrate versioning from .tomls
- `cargo update -p sp-std`

closes #338

candidates.title: Make primitives generic over Index, Hash and Balance
candidates.body:
- `ExtrinsicParams` is now generic over `Index` and `Hash` and the `Tip`s over the `Balance`. The most common types are still re-exported, but that does not make the primitives less generic. Therefore, I think this PR closes #119
- bump primitives crate to v0.2.1. (or should that rather be v0.3.0 @clangenb ?)

The Api and RpcClient are not yet generic. This will be done in a second step, ideally while implementing the Api Trait in #267

candidates.title: Remove unncesessary redefintion of substrate types
Bump version of all crates

labels.name: E0-silent
labels.description: Will not be mentioned in the release

candidates.body: Reasoning: The licence header has been changed since v0.1.0. I think that's reason enough for bumping everything

candidates.title: Clean up and harominze toml files

labels.name: F5-refactor
labels.description: Does not change any functionality of the code

candidates.body: Harmonize .tomls and the substrate import names. No logical changes at all.

candidates.title: update to polkadot-v0.9.31
candidates.body:
update to substrate commit [696bdc67af5fd83aca318263dbd405593b043ba3](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/commit/696bdc67af5fd83aca318263dbd405593b043ba3), which matches the polkadot-v0.9.31 branch

closes #301

candidates.title: Add get_account_identity example
candidates.body: closes #225

candidates.title: Add license check to CI
candidates.body:
closes #310 

- [x] Merge & rebase #309 
- [x] Blocked by: https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/12689 -> Solved by updating `array-bytes` to v4.2

candidates.title: Update node api to match recent version of substrate and subxt
candidates.body:
Metadata, events and error of the node api have been updated to match the current substrate and subxt once again (but `no_std` compatible). This was necessary to update the licence to Apache and allows for a much nicer event handling. Also, there were some unidentified errors, which probably happened due to the very outdated event handling (#263). 
To not break the interface more than necessary, the `wait_for_events` functions have been left as is, as much as possible. However, when solving #267 one should also think about a better interface. 

- ❗ Breaking changes in the `events` api. See the [example_contract_instantiate_with_code](https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/pull/309/files#diff-55169e505e67abab588cc1873a7bc2df36c8d972448974e255aed66daf455ec4)  to see how the new interface can be interacted with.

- ✅  Updates some of the examples to be more strict and readds them to CI.
E.g. example `event_error_details` now reports (and checks) the following error:
```
[+] Couldn't execute the extrinsic due to Dispatch(Module(ModuleError { pallet: "Balances", error: "InsufficientBalance", description: ["Balance too low to send value."], error_data: ModuleErrorData { pallet_index: 6, error: [2, 0, 0, 0] } }))
```


closes #274
closes #263

candidates.title: update to polkadot version v0.9.30
candidates.body:
- update polkadot version to master of v0.9.30
- update rust toolchain to 2022-11-05
- fix clippy lints

closes #300 

Follow up issue due to the clippy warnings: https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/issues/303 or https://github.com/scs/substrate-api-client/issues/267.

Didn't want to introduce any breaking interface changes in this PR.

chosen_pr.body:
Preparatory step for jsonrpsee inclusion.  

💥  Breaking Changes:
- `send_extrinsic(...)` is exchanged with:
    - `submit_extrinsic`: Replaces the `TxStatus::SubmitOnly`. It directly returns and does not require any subscription. The transaction hash is returned.

Instead of giving the `Sender` as an input, the `Receiver` is returned in a `WsSubscriptionWrapper`. The subscription value retrieved via the `next()` function (previously with `value.recv()`).
